entry.title: How to set up a wildcard subdomain on Google Domains
entry.content: Today, I was working with dokku, and I found myself in need of a wildcard subdomain. A wildcard DNS record is a record that will match requests for non-existent subdomains. For instance, if you set a wildcard DNS record to *.example.com, and a user requests random.example.com or foo.example.com, etc.. the requests will be forwarded to whichever server *.example.com points to.
